Sentencas: Matching the catalytic activity of nanostructured materials and processing parameters for high-temperature electrochemical devices is a challenge.
Titulo: Shape Control of Ceria Catalytic Supports for Enhanced Ethanol Reforming in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Controlling the nanoparticle shape has been proposed as an alternative method to stabilize crystalline surfaces to inhibit particle coarsening and sustain catalytic activity after high-temperature treatment.
Titulo: Shape Control of Ceria Catalytic Supports for Enhanced Ethanol Reforming in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this study, nickel-based catalysts supported on shape-controlled (nanorods and nanocubes) gadolinium-doped cerium oxide (GDC) were evaluated for the steam reforming reaction of ethanol, aiming at direct ethanol solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Shape Control of Ceria Catalytic Supports for Enhanced Ethanol Reforming in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The morphology of the support was shown to have an important role in the catalytic activity, particularly when heat treatments for fuel cell fabrication are considered.
Titulo: Shape Control of Ceria Catalytic Supports for Enhanced Ethanol Reforming in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The Ni catalyst supported on the GDC nanorods sustained the highest catalytic activity after heat treatment despite the morphology change of the support at high temperatures.
Titulo: Shape Control of Ceria Catalytic Supports for Enhanced Ethanol Reforming in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The excellent properties of the shape-controlled materials were demonstrated in SOFC using the Ni-GDC catalytic layer tailored for the operation on anhydrous ethanol at 700 degrees C.
Titulo: Shape Control of Ceria Catalytic Supports for Enhanced Ethanol Reforming in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The fuel cell exhibited a stable performance for more than 100 h of continuous operation without any sign of degradation due to carbon deposition.
Titulo: Shape Control of Ceria Catalytic Supports for Enhanced Ethanol Reforming in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Such a result is an important step toward the stable operation of direct ethanol intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Shape Control of Ceria Catalytic Supports for Enhanced Ethanol Reforming in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
